body_html:
Tried the alternative suggested by the site

The first part is completed without issues

~   
❯ export TF_BINARY_URL=https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-0.12.1-py3-none-any.whl
                                                                                                                                  
~   
❯ pip3 install --ignore-installed --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL
Collecting tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1 from https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-0.12.1-py3-none-any.whl
  Downloading https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-0.12.1-py3-none-any.whl (83.6MB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 83.6MB 6.9kB/s 
Collecting protobuf>=3.1.0 (from tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading protobuf-3.2.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (360kB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 368kB 71kB/s 
Collecting six>=1.10.0 (from tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Using cached six-1.10.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting wheel>=0.26 (from tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading wheel-0.29.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (66kB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 71kB 78kB/s 
Collecting numpy>=1.11.0 (from tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading numpy-1.12.0-cp35-cp35m-macosx_10_6_intel.macosx_10_9_intel.macosx_10_9_x86_64.macosx_10_10_intel.macosx_10_10_x86_64.whl (4.4MB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 4.4MB 50kB/s 
Collecting setuptools (from protobuf>=3.1.0->tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading setuptools-34.3.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl (389kB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 399kB 78kB/s 
Collecting appdirs>=1.4.0 (from setuptools->protobuf>=3.1.0->tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading appdirs-1.4.2-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting packaging>=16.8 (from setuptools->protobuf>=3.1.0->tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading packaging-16.8-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting pyparsing (from packaging>=16.8->setuptools->protobuf>=3.1.0->tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading pyparsing-2.1.10-py2.py3-none-any.whl (56kB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 61kB 63kB/s 
Installing collected packages: six, appdirs, pyparsing, packaging, setuptools, protobuf, wheel, numpy, tensorflow-gpu
Successfully installed appdirs-1.4.2 numpy-1.12.0 packaging-16.8 protobuf-3.2.0 pyparsing-2.1.10 setuptools-34.3.1 six-1.10.0 tensorflow-gpu-0.12.1 wheel-0.29.0

But when I actually try to import tensorflow, the session raises the following error

~
❯ python3
Python 3.5.2 |Anaconda custom (x86_64)| (default, Jul  2 2016, 17:52:12)
[GCC 4.2.1 Compatible Apple LLVM 4.2 (clang-425.0.28)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 49, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 28, in <module>
    _pywrap_tensorflow = swig_import_helper()
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper
    _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow', fp, pathname, description)
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/imp.py", line 242, in load_module
    return load_dynamic(name, filename, file)
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic
    return _load(spec)
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so, 10): Library not loaded: @rpath/libcudart.8.0.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
  Reason: image not found

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/__init__.py", line 24, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import *
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 60, in <module>
    raise ImportError(msg)
ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 49, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 28, in <module>
    _pywrap_tensorflow = swig_import_helper()
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper
    _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow', fp, pathname, description)
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/imp.py", line 242, in load_module
    return load_dynamic(name, filename, file)
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic
    return _load(spec)
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so, 10): Library not loaded: @rpath/libcudart.8.0.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
  Reason: image not found


Error importing tensorflow.  Unless you are using bazel,
you should not try to import tensorflow from its source directory;
please exit the tensorflow source tree, and relaunch your python interpreter
from there.
>>>

body:
Tried the alternative suggested by the site

The first part is completed without issues
```sh
~   
❯ export TF_BINARY_URL=https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-0.12.1-py3-none-any.whl
                                                                                                                                  
~   
❯ pip3 install --ignore-installed --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL
Collecting tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1 from https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-0.12.1-py3-none-any.whl
  Downloading https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-0.12.1-py3-none-any.whl (83.6MB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 83.6MB 6.9kB/s 
Collecting protobuf>=3.1.0 (from tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading protobuf-3.2.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (360kB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 368kB 71kB/s 
Collecting six>=1.10.0 (from tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Using cached six-1.10.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting wheel>=0.26 (from tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading wheel-0.29.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (66kB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 71kB 78kB/s 
Collecting numpy>=1.11.0 (from tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading numpy-1.12.0-cp35-cp35m-macosx_10_6_intel.macosx_10_9_intel.macosx_10_9_x86_64.macosx_10_10_intel.macosx_10_10_x86_64.whl (4.4MB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 4.4MB 50kB/s 
Collecting setuptools (from protobuf>=3.1.0->tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading setuptools-34.3.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl (389kB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 399kB 78kB/s 
Collecting appdirs>=1.4.0 (from setuptools->protobuf>=3.1.0->tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading appdirs-1.4.2-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting packaging>=16.8 (from setuptools->protobuf>=3.1.0->tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading packaging-16.8-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting pyparsing (from packaging>=16.8->setuptools->protobuf>=3.1.0->tensorflow-gpu==0.12.1)
  Downloading pyparsing-2.1.10-py2.py3-none-any.whl (56kB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 61kB 63kB/s 
Installing collected packages: six, appdirs, pyparsing, packaging, setuptools, protobuf, wheel, numpy, tensorflow-gpu
Successfully installed appdirs-1.4.2 numpy-1.12.0 packaging-16.8 protobuf-3.2.0 pyparsing-2.1.10 setuptools-34.3.1 six-1.10.0 tensorflow-gpu-0.12.1 wheel-0.29.0
```

But when I actually try to import tensorflow, the session raises the following error

```python3

~
❯ python3
Python 3.5.2 |Anaconda custom (x86_64)| (default, Jul  2 2016, 17:52:12)
[GCC 4.2.1 Compatible Apple LLVM 4.2 (clang-425.0.28)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 49, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 28, in <module>
    _pywrap_tensorflow = swig_import_helper()
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper
    _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow', fp, pathname, description)
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/imp.py", line 242, in load_module
    return load_dynamic(name, filename, file)
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic
    return _load(spec)
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so, 10): Library not loaded: @rpath/libcudart.8.0.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
  Reason: image not found

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/__init__.py", line 24, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import *
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 60, in <module>
    raise ImportError(msg)
ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 49, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 28, in <module>
    _pywrap_tensorflow = swig_import_helper()
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper
    _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow', fp, pathname, description)
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/imp.py", line 242, in load_module
    return load_dynamic(name, filename, file)
  File "/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic
    return _load(spec)
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so, 10): Library not loaded: @rpath/libcudart.8.0.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/eklavya/anaconda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
  Reason: image not found


Error importing tensorflow.  Unless you are using bazel,
you should not try to import tensorflow from its source directory;
please exit the tensorflow source tree, and relaunch your python interpreter
from there.
>>>
```
